functions.population.data¶

Module containing functions for building population datasets.

Module Contents¶

functions.population.data.in_bounds(raster, y, x)¶

Check if array access at index (y,x) is in bounds of raster.

functions.population.data.get_context(raster, y, x, n)¶

Return mean of n x n context area surrounding index (y,x) of raster.

functions.population.data.get_val_split(df, n=2, coord='y', leaf=False)¶

Returns list of (n x n) pandas dataframes, corresponding to splitting df spatially into (n x n) segments with approx equal numbers of survey points by:

  1. splitting into n segments by y coordinate, then

  2. splitting each segment into n segments by x coordinate.

functions.population.data.label_folds(dfs)¶

Returns concatenatenation of dataframes in list dfs, each labelled with a unique value in the ‘fold’ column.

functions.population.data.mark_outliers(df, outliers, col=2)¶

Mark members of df with outlier values defined in csv file.

functions.population.data.init_cols(feature_names, context_sizes)¶

Initialize dictionary with column names.

functions.population.data.build_row(d, y, x, pop, rasters, feature_names, context_sizes)¶

Build row (in-place) of population dataset corresponding to grid cell .

Parameters

  • d (dict) – Dictionary used to build dataset.

  • y (int) – y coord of grid cell covered by row.

  • x (int) – x coord of grid cell covered by row.

  • pop (int) – population of grid cell (where known).

  • rasters (list of np.ndarray) – rasters containing features.

  • feature_names (list of np.ndarray) – name for each raster in rasters.

  • context_sizes (list of int) – sizes of n x n feature contexts to compute.

Returns

None.

functions.population.data.build_dataset(params, survey_only=True)¶

Build dataset of features with context, population labels according to specifications in file params_path.

Parameters

  • params (dict) – A dictionary holding parameters.

  • survey_only (bool) – True if building dataset for only sampled survey tiles.

Returns

Pandas DataFrame containing full dataset.

Return type

pd.DataFrame
